fields.description:
If multiple users are editing an issue concurrently, it is possible that one of them may attempt to delete an attachment that another has already deleted. If you do so, a System Error is displayed - this would be better as a friendly error message.

Repro steps:
1) Open two browser windows and log into JIRA in both.
2) Go to the Manage Attachments page for the same issue in both.
3) Delete an attachment in the first window.
4) Delete the attachment in the second window.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. View any issue is full screen.
3. Now user wants to view 2 browser window side by side. Hence user make the screen half the size horizontally, no change in vertical size.
4. User try to view the other end of issue using horizontal scroll bar.

Result:
1. As user moves to other side of the screen, the stalker bar also moves and hence user is unable to access menu items like "View".

Expected:
1. The stalker bar should n't move with user.
fields.summary: JIRA stalker bar menu moves with user(on horizontal scrollbar),making it impossible to access "View" menu in small screen.e

fields.description:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/download/attachments/1815806191/Release-Notes-ambiguous-functionality.png?version=1&modificationDate=1265676793814

Raised during JIRA 4.1 blitz by ggaskell

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/2010-02-09+-+JIRA+-+4.1-+Iteration+5+-+Giles%27+findings

When a user hovers their mouse over the 'Edit/Copy Release Notes', it 'appears' as though clicking this link will actually do something, like copying the content of the text box. However, clicking this link apparently does nothing at all. If a user assumes that this link copies the text box content, they could end up losing the content upon closing this page.
Solutions:

Either:
    * Remove the 'mouse over link' UI functionality - i.e. mouse pointer 'arrow' turns into a 'hand' and text becomes underlined.
    * Actually copy the content upon clicking the link. However, this function is probably better represented with a button. The design team would probably be best making a judgement call on this.
fields.summary: Edit/Copy Release Notes link does nothing

fields.description: There is a space between the word "account" and the final "." in the message "You must log in  or sign up for an account ." In FireFox, the full-stop wraps to the next line on the "You are not logged in" page. It's a one-pixel problem but it keeps bothering me :-)

fields.description:
If a user is browsing JIRA anonymously and can perform no actions/transitions on an issue, a "Log In" button is displayed on the Ops bar.

However, if the instance is configured to allow users to perform actions or transitions anonymously - as is the default behaviour for custom transitions (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-11564), or if specific permissions are granted to "Anyone" in the permissions scheme; there is no login button displayed. 

I think consistency (anonymous user = Login button displayed) would be clearer to the user than only displaying the button if there are no valid options.
fields.summary: "Log In" button is not displayed on ops bar if logged out and workflow transitions are available

fields.description:
If a user lacks the 'View Voters and Watchers' permission but has the 'Manage Watchers'; there is an inconsistency in the visible information available via JQL and the issue view.

For example, consider the following project's permission scheme:
!Edit Permissions - JIRA 4.1 Iteration 5 QA.png!

Only members of the 'jira-administrators' are able to 'View Voters and Watchers'.

Such a user is able to do so via JQL:
!User Profile _ Peter de Zwart - JIRA 4.1 Iteration 5 QA.png!
!Issue Navigator - JIRA 4.1 Iteration 5 QA-1.png!

Consider a user that is not a member of the 'jira-administrators' group and lacks the 'View Voters and Watchers' permission but is a member of the 'jira-developers' group which is conferred the 'Manage Watchers' permission:
!ESX Monitoring VM-10.png!

They do not see the same list of issues as the member of the 'jira-administrators' group did via JQL:
!ESX Monitoring VM-11.png!

However, if they view the issue, they are then allowed to view the watchers because of the conferred 'Manage Watchers' permission:
!ESX Monitoring VM-12.png!

This is inconsistent with JQL where they are not allowed to view this information.

I suggest that either JQL allows users which possess the 'Manage Watchers' permission to be able to view watchers via the {{watcher}} clause in JQL; or that 'Manage Watchers' requires the user to also have the 'View Voters and Watchers' permission.
fields.summary: Permissions - View Watchers/Voters vs. Manage Watchers/Voters - Inconsistency of visible information between JQL & issue view

fields.description:
If the user is looking at the keyboard shortcut help dialogue (triggered by pressing "?"), he/she may try a shortcut straight away rather than dismissing the dialogue first. Currently it would have no effect.

My expectation is that the shortcuts - or at the bare minimum, just the global shortcuts - would auto-dismiss the dialogue then execute the associated action.

fields.description:
The wording in the Login details column could be better.  If they didn't login we say 'Not recorded'.  I think that would be better as 'Never logged in'.

Also if they have logged in we still say 'Not recorded' underneath the stats (see screenshots).  Not sure that needs to be there at all.
fields.summary: User browser Login details column doesn't make sense

Steps:

2. View any issue and click "Clone" link.

Result:
1. User gets a huge stack trace in logs. Log file attached.
2. User gets "Exception: com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: Error occurred while creating issue through workflow: User 'null' doesn't have the 'Create Issue' permission" error in UI
3. This issue is with JIRA 4.0 also.

Expected:
1. A better user friendly message in UI.
2. No Stack trace.

fields.description:
When there are zero watchers on an issue, the number "0" is a link to the "Manage Watchers" page.
When there are zero voters on an issue, the number "0" is *not* a link to the "Manage Voters" page.

However, if the current user is the only voter on the issue and removes his/her vote, the number of voters changes to "0" but remains a link.

Since the text "Votes" remains a link at all times, for consistency it would make sense for the number to remain a link as well.
fields.summary: Manage Voters/Watchers link behaviour is inconsistent when there are zero voters/watchers

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20835].
  {panel}

After you have clicked on create new query, the functionality of "View" link doesn't make much sense. Currently it shows you an empty results screen and clears the query you were working on.

The "View" link should either:
- Not be present for new queries until they've been run
- Perform the same function as the "Search" button.
- Only be present if there was a previously run query. In which case selecting View shows the results of the previous query.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20829].
  {panel}

User Story:
As a JIRA administrator, I want to grant my users the right to add arbitrary watchers to the list, but only to remove themselves, so that the users cannot unwillingly delete watchers from the list.

Acceptance Criteria:
* The current functionality must be preserved.
* An additional setting (e.g. via Permission Scheme) can grant the right to add users to the watcher list
* As a user with that additional setting, I can only remove myself from the list
* I cannot remove others from the list, even when I added them myself
fields.summary: Add permission to add, but not to remove watches

fields.description:
The latest JIRA 4.1-RC POM (in our public m2 repo [here|https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/public/com/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira/4.1-rc1-b516/atlassian-jira-4.1-rc1-b516.pom]) is pointing at oracle-jdbc15, with the comment that we distribute that artifact with our software.

However, there is no oracle-jdbc15 artifact in our public repo (expected [here|https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/public/com/oracle/oracle-jdbc15/11.2.0.1.0] but only found [here|https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/internal/com/oracle/oracle-jdbc15/11.2.0.1.0]).  I'm not sure if it should be there, or whether the dependency shouldn't be in the POM (it's not clear from Oracle's licensing terms that we're actually allowed to redistribute their JDBC stuff).

In any event, this is causing [trouble|https://bamboo.developer.atlassian.com/browse/AMPS-NOSHITTY-110] for the Plugin SDK's integration tests: it tries to pull JIRA, to create and install a dummy plugin, but fails on the oracle-jdbc dependency.
fields.summary: atlassian-jira pom depends on oracle-jdbc15, not in public

fields.description:
CONFIRMED: Root cause is Shindig tracked here https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SHINDIG-801 via Atlassian Gadgets tracked here https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AG-1264

I've created plugin for JIRA. It is a gadget and a REST-service supporting this gadget. 
The REST-service is stateless, by request it returns a huge JSON (about 5Mb). 
I've found memory leak: after few hours using my plugin JIRA stops working with OutOfMemoryError. Exploring dump-file I found that all of JSON-responses are stored in org.apache.shindig.gadgets.http.DefaultHttpCache. It is mapping of requests and responses. So there is cached response for each request's parameters combination, but in my situations it is absolutely not necessary. 
Moreover, I tried to send a request with the same parameters as stored in cache. I was surprised to find that the REST-service has processed the request and a new response was returned and cache was updated. So it looks like cache is not used, but takes a lot of memory only.
I haven't found how to switch off this cache for my service. I've posted message to forums - no answer.
fields.summary: Memory leak, Gadget and REST service

fields.description:

People in my company just cannot afford using shared dashboards in Jira 4 because favourite list eats up 20% of full screen (even if you don't try to use sensible dashboard names and only have two dashboards in your "favourite" list).
Very wasteful, very annoying.
Please make favourite list either drop-down menu or horizontal (like it was in 3.12 plugin) or configurable if anyone likes the current layout.

fields.description:
I've spent HOURS trying to get Jira installed on a Linux/Apache/Tomcat server.  I found your installation documentation very inadequate, and in the end does not work.  I have opened up a trouble ticket and am waiting for support to contact me.

Many other products I've been evaluating have pre-built virtual appliances that I can download and boot using VMWare.  All I needed to do was download them, unzip them, and fire up the VM.  These appliances are ready-to-run and configured with default parameters so you can be up and running FAST so that customers can spend their time evaluating the product, and not trying to get it to run.

I'm not interested in a hosted option, which is why I'm installing it in-house.  If we like the product and decide to move forward, I can move it from my workstation VM to our VMWare vSphere 4 environment.

Thank you for your consideration
fields.summary: Create pre-built virtual appliance for Jira and Confluence

fields.description:
My project is set up so that adding a comment from the view issue screen results in an email notification being sent to the reporter and assignee.  This is working as expected.

If I use the "Link this issue to another issue" operation from the view issue screen and add a comment on the resulting screen, no email notifications are delivered to the reporter and assignee.

I created a plugin with an issue event listener to see what IssueEvents were getting fired during the link operation and neither the issueComment nor the workflowEvent methods of the event listener were being called.

Shouldn't adding a comment when linking an issue result in an issueEvent being fired?
fields.summary: Email notifications are not sent when a comment is added to an issue during a link issue operation

fields.description:
According to the docs, its possible to create lists, maps, and arrays inline:
http://mvel.codehaus.org/Inline+List%2C+Maps+and+Arrays

However, with conditionals in the expression before checks against the inline list, an error occurs.


{quote}["Jim", "Bob", "Smith"].contains("Jim"){quote} => works

{quote}["Jim", "Bob", "Smith"].contains("Jim") and 1==1{quote} => works

{quote}1==1 and ["Jim", "Bob", "Smith"].contains("Jim"){quote}

doesn't work
error:

{quote}
[Error: unexpected token: and  ["Jim","Bob","Smith"].contains("Jim")]
[Near : {... ob","Smith"].contains("Jim" ....}]
                                          ^
[Line: 1, Column: 0]
	at org.mvel2.compiler.AbstractParser.arithmeticFunctionReduction(AbstractParser.java:2370)
	at org.mvel2.MVELInterpretedRuntime.parseAndExecuteInterpreted(MVELInterpretedRuntime.java:131)
	at org.mvel2.MVELInterpretedRuntime.parse(MVELInterpretedRuntime.java:44)
	at org.mvel2.MVEL.eval(MVEL.java:168)
{quote}

However, if I assign a list to a variable and then try the same expression, it works fine:
{quote}mylist = ["Jim", "Bob", "Smith"];
1==1 and mylist.contains("Smith"){quote}

=> works
fields.summary: inline list method calls with previous operators

fields.description:
We have development offices located in the US and India.  Currently Jira has only a single time setting - Server Time.  This makes it difficult to guage the difference in time between what a developer in US has done vs what a developer in India has done on a ticket.

Proposed Solution:
-ability to select a time zone for the User Profile.  This would then render all times according to the users time zone.  

Example:
-my User Profile time zone is EST
-when I view comments on a ticket, the 'created' time is according to my time zone
-(a developer in India could have added the comment at 9am their local time - that is midnight for me - I need to be able to related actions according to my time zone)
fields.summary: User Profiles > Time Zones - the ability to select a time zone per user profile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20799].
  {panel}

When comments are created by email and notifications result in another comment (usually involving a second system similarly configured) an unbounded mail loop is created.

Today SAC was bought down by two JIRAs cross connected via their mailboxes.

Someone created an account for enterprise-hosted-support@atlassian.com on their JIRA, this caused SAC to create an issue on the EHSP support queue, and reply back to the reporter with an email saying it had done so. This caused the remote JIRA to create an issue on it's side and send a notification that it had done so back to SAC. Because this email contained the EHSP key, SAC filed the email as a comment, and replied telling it had done so. This caused the remote to create a new issue (as the issue key didn't match on its side), and reply to SAC ...

!http://img.skitch.com/20100331-jq568ibubyw825hsxxk1ya2mdb.jpg!

_hilarity did not ensue_

Also note the Ubisoft + JAC loop that happened here: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-5865
fields.summary: JIRA should limit the number of comments created via email to avoid mailing loops

fields.description:
We have a number of users who use Microsoft Excel to generate reports on issues stored in JIRA. We currently have two options for getting issue data from JIRA to Excel.

1) we export search results to excel file and import into Excel
2) we create a Web Query in excel using URL to JIRA printable view

The users prefer option 2 as they can just refresh the Excel Web Query and rerun their macros to update the Excel based reports. The only issue with option 1 is that the user needs to copy the URL from JIRA, create a new spreadsheet and web query manually. It would be nice if JIRA had option to create a new spreadsheet with embedded Web Query from the JIRA Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to generate reports from Excel using JIRA as external data source.
Extend SOAP API to include adding, deleting, and modifying issue filters
Add ability to tune/flush JIRA caches in the UI

fields.description:
I've been trying to see if there was a good way that would allow me to accomplish the following:

1. As an admin, I go to JIRA and create a new project. This action also results in the creation of a new space in confluence and the appropriate groups in crowd.

2. A more integrated version would allow me to identify an existing SCM repos or create a new one; link it with Fisheye, link a bamboo plan etc.

This is similar in concept to GForge where as I create a new project, I create new wiki's, SCM, tests etc.

Doesn't look like there are any existing plugins to achieve this. I think it would be a cool capability to have in JIRA
fields.summary: An Integration Plugin

fields.description: The [Converting Standard Issues to Sub Task|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Sub-Task#CreatingaSub-Task-Convertingastandardissuetoasubtask] and [Converting Sub Task to Standard Issue|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Sub-Task#CreatingaSub-Task-Convertingasubtasktoastandardissue] should mention that 'Edit Issues' permission is required in order to perform these action. The [Permission Schemes|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/permissions.html] explained that 'Edit Permission' is needed in order for user to be able to convert the sub-task to standard issue and vice versa. However, there is no explanation in the Sub Task documentation itself. This might can be added in the documentation in Notes format.
fields.summary: Improvement on Sub Task Documentation

fields.description:
When creating a filter 'FixVersion not in ( A, B, C, D)' issues without a version are NOT returned.
This is confusing for users that are not up to speed with the concept of 'NULL'.


It might be too late to adapt as changing this behaviour might break the semantic of existing filters.
fields.summary: JQL - "FixVersions not in ( A, B, C, D)' doesn't return issues without Fixversion
Gadget URL length problem

fields.description:
I see that JRA-10021 was closed as answered but I would like to see an RFE for it.  When moving issues in JIRA, many people expect them to be automatically reassigned to the project lead or component lead in the destination project.

In our case, we have seen some issues ignored for days before the current assignee realizes that they still own an issue and need to reassign it.

This is also related to JRA-20692.  Implementing that should do well enough to address this problem for most people but I would also like to have the option of automatic reassignment in the new project.

A similar problem with cloning issues can be worked around by defining a post-function on the Create Issue workflow transition to set the assignee but this does not seem to be possible with moving issues.
fields.summary: Automatic reassignment when moving an issue into a new project

fields.description:
In our company we intensively use shared dashboards, some of them have many of gadgets.
What users do - they minimize not needed gadgets to have more screen space and make refreshes work faster.
Unfortunately this setting is not saved between the sessions
fields.summary: Save gadget setting (maximized, minimized, normal) between logon sessions

fields.description: We currently have a Notification Scheme that posts to a mailing list on "Issue Created" event. This is good for when new issues (bugs, stories) are created. However, we do not want to send emails to list when sub-tasks are created under an existing story. We find this is too granular and adds noise to the mailing list. We would like a way to configure the notification scheme to NOT send notification email for sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Ability to not send notification for sub-tasks on Issue Created event.

fields.description:
We would like the functionality to be able to export Dashboards to either PDF or Word document format.


This works well with Confluence and would really benefit us as we have designed our dashboards to provide MI statistics but can't currently easily get them into a more general report.
fields.summary: The functionality to export a dashboard to PDF or Word

fields.description: When adding a comment, the user is presented with a frame whereby the main issue remains viewable in the bottom. However, if they press Add without adding a comment, the interface switches to the old method and all context of the issue is lost. See attached.
fields.summary: Inconsistency adding comments

fields.description:
The latest beta seems to be packaged without Remote API plug-in(s)

1. Download and install 4.1 beta build 515 from http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/EAPDownloads.jspa 
2. Enable "Accept Remote API Calls" in the configuration
3. Try to open http://localhost:8080/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2?wsdl or http://localhost:8080/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2

Expected: SOAP endpoint answers

Observed: HTTP 404 

Also, Administrator interface does not show any Remote API plug-ins.
fields.summary: JIRA 4.1 beta completely misses Remote API plug-ins

fields.description:
I find it hard to reply to a comment in JIRA now because the add comment box is at the top of the screen, while the comments (including the most recent one I want to reply to) are at the bottom.

Two requests for further UI work in 4.2:

- put the comment box back where it was - at the bottom of the screen, rather than the top
- put an 'Add Comment' button at the bottom of the comments (as requested in JRA-11682).

This follows a pretty standard usability guideline: put controls near the content they act upon. Reply and add comment links should be somewhere near the comments, not up in a toolbar that has a bunch of unrelated functionality.
fields.summary: New comment UI is difficult to use when replying

fields.description:
When the server.xml context {color:green}{{*path="/"*}}{color} certain links in JIRA are missing the *host:port* sub-string.
e.g: http://localhost:8080/secure/admin/AddProject!default.jspa -> http://secure/admin/AddProject!default.jspa

Just to list a few:
- *Administration > Project > Project* page
-- {color:blue}_Add Project_{color} link
-- Project name link
-- icons for both are missing
-- {color:blue}_View, Edit, Delete_{color} operation links for the project
- *Administration > Global Settings*
-- *Events* page
--- {color:blue}_Associated Notification Schemes_{color} links for each event
--- {color:blue}_Associated Workflows_{color} links for each event
-- *Perforce Job Integration* page
--- {color:blue}_Configure JIRA, FishEye, Crucible_{color} link
-- *Global Permissions* page
--- {color:blue}_View Users_{color} link next to groups
-- *Look and Feel* page
--- The colour picker pop-ups don't work
-- *Sub-tasks* page
--- standard issue types {color:blue}_here_{color} link
--- {color:blue}_Manage_{color} Sub-Tasks link
- *Administration > Schemes*
-- *Permission Schemes* page
--- see {color:blue}_Global Permissions_{color} link
--- links to the associated projects for the permission scheme
-- *Workflow Schemes* page
--- View all {color:blue}_workflows_{color} link
--- workflows associated to the workflow scheme based on mapped issue types
---- also on the Edit Workflows page when you click on Workflows Operation
-- *Scheme tools* page
--- perform a full {color:blue}_backup_{color} link
--- all four links to the tools and in their description

Any many more...

The problem does not occur when {{*path=""*}} (as the default web application).
Tested in JIRA 4.0.2 and 4.1-rc1 on Windows.
fields.summary: Malformed URLs when server.xml context path="/" for standalone distribution
